other_tests.findings: Morning plasma cortisol was less than 27 nmol/liter and did not rise in response to iv administration of 250 µg synthetic ACTH-(1 –24). Baseline plasma ACTH was markedly elevated at 252 and 142 pmol/liter.
Plasma ACTH was more than 330 pmol/liter on two occasions.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Plasma ACTH was 330 pmol/liter (1500 ng/liter) at 4 3/12 years of age.

other_tests.findings: The patient responded well to iv saline, glucose and hydrocortisone during an episode of nausea, vomiting, dehydration, hyponatremia, hypoglycemia, and a grand mal seizure.
other_tests.changes_over_time: He has done well on replacement doses of hydrocortisone, with stress doses at the time of illness.
